title: Buyer Support Analyst - 12 month
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionised entire industries. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it.
description: Implement the supply plan and procure the products or commodities assigned. Optimise planning process, complete weekly plans to minimise future gaps by reviewing new buy and repair plan recommend by the planning system. Keeping planning system master data up to date and initiate Engineering Change request based on material life cycle. Responsible for key performance metrics such as backlog, fill rate, inventory turn, purchase orders price variance and past due delivery management. Analyse forecasted demand, inventory, develop weekly supply plans that meet customer demands. Results should meet AppleCare’s target of fill rate, while minimising total inventory cost. Analyse and resolve product backlogs, fill rates every day. Identify problem areas, and drive appropriate functional groups to correct. Manage procurement and repair activities including setting up repair supply chain, execute, expedite the repair purchase orders, streamlining repair cycle, working with supplier manager to ensure supply plans meets requirements. Resolve shipping and receiving issue, invoice variance, payment issues and manage purchase orders reconciliation with the suppliers. Find opportunities for system enhancement and work with key business partners and IT to implement continuous system improvements.
preferred_qualifications: Ability to both think strategically and execute tactically, a persistent attention to details, and a high level of comfort in working with numbers. Experience in managing suppliers, purchase orders management, onboarding new suppliers, resolving shipping and billing discrepancies. A working knowledge of supply chain practices. Effective in communication, influencing, and negotiation in a matrix organisation including one-on-one, small and large groups, and with peers and executives. Consistent track record in delivering on operational KPI’s. Experience with cross-functional collaboration to achieve outstanding results in a fast-paced environment. Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business analytics, data science, BIS or equivalent experience
